metadata.title: CVE-2012-5484 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The client in FreeIPA 2.x and 3.x before 3.1.2 does not properly obtain theCertification Authority (CA) certificate from the server, which allowsman-in-the-middle attackers to spoof a join procedure via a craftedcertificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5484` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeipa-admintools - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
freeipa-client - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
freeipa-server - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
freeipa-server-trust-ad - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
freeipa-tests - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
python-freeipa - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeipa package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-0ubuntu1').
